[{'created': '2011-12-12 18:04:33.000000000', 'message': "Serialize compute methods on instance

Fixes bug 897887

The compute manager allows multiple operations on an instance to run at
the same time, creating a variety of interesting race conditions. This
change serializes compute methods to an individual instance. If an
instance is deleted while it is still being built, the delete will now
wait until after the build is finished.

This also changes the XenAPI agent related configuration to be synchronous
to ensure that work doesn't race with deletes either.

Change-Id: I294b595128979e153c797d9e610b66bc76f47666
"}, {'created': '2011-12-12 20:01:29.000000000', 'message': "Prevent instance deletion while building

Fixes bug 897887

The Openstack API says that the only statuses an instance may be deleted
from are ACTIVE and ERROR, so enforce this action.

This also changes the XenAPI agent related configuration to be synchronous
to ensure that work doesn't race with deletes either.

Change-Id: I294b595128979e153c797d9e610b66bc76f47666

commit_message:
Make XenAPI agent configuration synchronous

Fixes bug 897887

Much of the XenAPI agent configuration happens asynchronously from the
spawn process. This allows the instance to go ACTIVE state earlier and
leaves the possibility of a race with delete open. This makes the
steps synchronous, ensuring the process only goes to ACTIVE after the
configuration is done.

Change-Id: I294b595128979e153c797d9e610b66bc76f47666

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-12-08 22:24:34.000000000', 'message': "Fixes LP Bug#901534 - Lost properties in upload

Adds test cases that verify the bug behaviour.

Adds some logic to the main API images controller
update() method that does the following:

* If an image file is being uploaded, do not purge
  existing properties when updating metadata. The idea
  behind this change is that a very common scenario is
  to register an image entry with Glance with some
  properties (like instance_uuid, instance_type, etc) and
  then immediately upload an image (usually snapshots).
  We don't want to mark deleted the originally-registered
  properties during the image upload, which was what was
  happening.

* Add ability to force Glance NOT to purge properties
  when calling PUT /images/<IMAGE_ID> if the
  X-Glance-Registry-Purge-Props: false
  header is passed.

Change-Id: Ie66af8f052ab40d5dca7a3235fdbbb7de20372de
"}, {'created': '2011-12-15 15:10:57.000000000', 'message': "Fixes LP Bug#901534 - Lost properties in upload

Adds test cases that verify the bug behaviour.

Adds some logic to the main API images controller
update() method that does the following:

* If an image file is being uploaded, do not purge
  existing properties when updating metadata. The idea
  behind this change is that a very common scenario is
  to register an image entry with Glance with some
  properties (like instance_uuid, instance_type, etc) and
  then immediately upload an image (usually snapshots).
  We don't want to mark deleted the originally-registered
  properties during the image upload, which was what was
  happening.

* Add ability to force Glance NOT to purge properties
  when calling PUT /images/<IMAGE_ID> if the
  X-Glance-Registry-Purge-Props: false
  header is passed.

Change-Id: Ie66af8f052ab40d5dca7a3235fdbbb7de20372de
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes LP Bug#901534 - Lost properties in upload

Adds test cases that verify the bug behaviour.

Adds some logic to the main API images controller
update() method that does the following:

* If an image file is being uploaded, do not purge
  existing properties when updating metadata. The idea
  behind this change is that a very common scenario is
  to register an image entry with Glance with some
  properties (like instance_uuid, instance_type, etc) and
  then immediately upload an image (usually snapshots).
  We don't want to mark deleted the originally-registered
  properties during the image upload, which was what was
  happening.

* Add ability to force Glance NOT to purge properties
  when calling PUT /images/<IMAGE_ID> if the
  X-Glance-Registry-Purge-Props: false
  header is passed.

Change-Id: Ie66af8f052ab40d5dca7a3235fdbbb7de20372de

commit_message:
Refactors handling of detach volume

 * removes unnecessary flags in detach_volume call
 * stops double detach reported in bug 887402
 * moves volume.API() into init

Change-Id: I65332cabedf2edb88acb48b3293cba291d440238

messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-30 18:07:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-12-01 06:17:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

tl;dr.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-12-01 06:21:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2011-12-01 12:52:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This feels like a silly question, but where has the authentication gone? You've removed a bunch of is_admin checks, but I don't see what they've been replaced with?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-12-01 13:50:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Soren: 

The approach I am taking removes auth in favor of deploying the admin api on a different ip/port from the EC2 and OpenStack APIs. The idea is that a deployer can handle locking it down. If you have concerns with that, I'm all ears :)"}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2011-12-01 14:06:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Thanks for clarifying, Brian.

Not having any kind of authn/authz guarding this gives me the heebie
jeebies.

I think it's in everyone's best interest to keep this packed away behind
authn/authz (of some kind). For the company, because I don't think it'll
generally be straightforward to have your support staff have exclusive
access to a network resource like this (and the whole point is to limit
access to it), but also for your support staff: If there's no
authentication and someone finds a way to access this resource, the
blame for any misconduct will fall upon the support staff by default
(until the network breach is discovered (assuming that ever happens))."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-12-01 21:53:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not submit

I'm actually starting to rethink whether this should be done at all... let met think on it."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-12-15 05:56:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Different approach coming...'}]

subject: Fixes bug 887402
messages:
[{'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-12-14 18:01:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hm.  Isn't the real problem that after the calls in libvirt to the 'disconnect_volume' driver method, there's no removing of the volume from the block device mapping table?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-12-14 19:18:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I would prefer to change check_exit_code to take a list of valid exit codes instead of using some undocumented behavior.

I like making disconnect idempotent, but I am curious why it is getting called twice.  I notice that there are calls to detach_volume in shutdown_instance.  If that is what is causing this issue, maybe we just can go ahead and remove those?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-12-14 21:04:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So I looked into this in more detail.  I think the change to allow multiple disconnects is totally fine, as it should be an idempotent call.  However I see why it is happening twice and I'm going to refactor the method call a little bit to fix it and propose in a separate review."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-12-14 21:47:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Vish: So do you change your -1 to a +1?    If so, I'll be a +1 too... and assume code coming from you will fix this further."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-12-14 21:47:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Nevermind... I see the comment about exit_codes.  I would agree with addressing that first.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2011-12-14 23:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-12-15 00:18:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I like this fix.  My refactor is here:

https://review.openstack.org/2346'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2011-12-15 00:46:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-12-15 00:47:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

ah pep8 :)'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-12-15 01:12:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-12-15 01:21:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/263/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/2026/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/651/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-12-15 01:21:58.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 357, 'date': '2011-12-15 04:39:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So this breaks pretty much every thing in the code base that specifies check_exit_code=False since you aren't ever treating it as a boolean."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-12-15 04:41:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Ugh.  Quick follow up patch needed then.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2011-12-15 05:04:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Change I5d09b65d restores the boolean behaviour.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2011-12-14 17:49:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes bug 887402

disconnect_volume() is called twice if a volume is attached and the
instance is terminated.  Return codes 0 and 255 are both valid on
logout/delete in this case.

This relies on a property of utils.execute to not check error codes
at all if check_exit_code is not an integer

Change-Id: Icffeb0fe8269a02d95ac6ed180ba0bb9f458a6ed
'}, {'created': '2011-12-14 23:24:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes bug 887402

Change utils.execute to accept a list or a single integer in
check_exit_code.

In libvirt.disconnect_volume() return codes 0 and 255 are both valid
for logout/delete, where 255 is returned if the volume is already
disconnected.

Change-Id: Icffeb0fe8269a02d95ac6ed180ba0bb9f458a6ed
'}, {'created': '2011-12-15 00:46:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes bug 887402

Change utils.execute to accept a list or a single integer in
check_exit_code.

In libvirt.disconnect_volume() return codes 0 and 255 are both valid
for logout/delete, where 255 is returned if the volume is already
disconnected.

Change-Id: Icffeb0fe8269a02d95ac6ed180ba0bb9f458a6ed
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes bug 887402

Change utils.execute to accept a list or a single integer in
check_exit_code.

In libvirt.disconnect_volume() return codes 0 and 255 are both valid
for logout/delete, where 255 is returned if the volume is already
disconnected.

Change-Id: Icffeb0fe8269a02d95ac6ed180ba0bb9f458a6ed

subject: Skipping venv checks when using --just-pep8.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-12-15 02:57:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Won't we use pep8 from the venv if it's there? And we do that so we can all use a consistent version (pegged at 0.6.1) to prevent inconsistent results (something we've already had to deal with). I also don't feel like it's that big of a deal, as you shouldn't need to rebuild your venv very often..."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-12-15 03:11:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Brian: Good point about the pegged pep8 version--had forgotten about all of those issues.

WRT not rebuilding venv often, that's true, though some of us run from site-packages, so we're prompted all of the time.

Solution is already there for that via the `-N` option.

I'll go ahead an Reject the bug and Abandon this change.

Good catch!"}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-12-15 03:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Pegging PEP8 via venv is necessary, so this change is (sadly) not possible.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-12-15 03:15:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, I'm glad we see eye-to-eye here :)"}]

'}]

commit_message:
floating-ip: return UUID of instance rather than ID

Returning the database ID seems useless now that instances are identified by
UUID. So it seems more reasonable to return UUID here too.

Change-Id: I36fa6ded284158facb891dd081aa3d3f45c7c5ee
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien.danjou@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Make various methods static

A lot of stuff in nova.virt contain methods that are
actually static. Marking them this way makes the code clearer.

Change-Id: I287058d3b2315562f2980999239fcd3240d2b1ec
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien.danjou@enovance.com>
